text:
Is there an ideal way of exiting Julia, especially when using CUDA.jl?
I have been encountering this problem since the past 3 days. Whenever I load CUDA.jl into the Julia REPL on a fresh boot, it runs perfectly and I can initialize arrays using `y=CUDA.fill(1.0f0,1000)` with no problem whatsoever.
But then when I quit Julia and start Julia again, load the package, and try to initialize another array, it gives me an error which is seemingly popular-
```ERROR: CUDA.jl did not successfully initialize, and is not usable.
If you did not see any other error message, try again in a new session
with the JULIA_DEBUG environment variable set to 'CUDA'.```
